meta.name: description
meta.content: Lakeview Public Schools serves students and is located in St. Clair Shores, MI.

div.span: Lakeview Public Schools will be working virtually with our students and families through the end of the 2019-2020 school year.

article.aria-label: Lakeview Meal Service Pick-Up During School Shutdown - Car window pick-up at Lakeview High School (LHS), 21100 11 Mile Rd

h3.a: Lakeview Meal Service Pick-Up During School Shutdown - Car window pick-up at Lakeview High School (LHS), 21100 11 Mile Rd

div.div:
Meal Service Pick Up Schedule: *No meal pick-up dates scheduled during Spring Break. Please click on the link for additional specific information.
April 14, 16, 21, 23, 28, 30, 2020. 6:30 am to 7:30 am and again from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm.
May 5, 7, 12, 14, 19, 21, 26, 28, 2020. 6:30 am to 7:30 am and again from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm.
June 2, 4, 9, 11, 2020. 6:30 am to 7:30 am and again from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm.

This year, you have three options to respond: Online, by phone or by mail. All it takes is 10 minutes to fill out, and you can have an impact on the next 10 years for our schools, city, county and state.
SCHOOL OF CHOICE enrollment is now OPEN for the 2020-2021 school year...
Schaublin Auditorium is a state-of-the-art performance venue! Our high school cafeteria has audio/visual presentation capabilities, a 400-seat capacity, and an area for catering!

27575 Harper Ave.
St. Clair Shores, MI 48081

div.span:
Fax Machine Notice: Due to any unforeseen technical issues,
the District does not guarantee that all fax machines are in working order at all times.
Please follow-up with a phone call to confirm your fax was received.

div.div: Nondiscrimination and Access to Equal Education Opportunity

It is the policy of the Board that no student in this District shall, on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, height, weight, and/or any other legally protected characteristic, be discriminated against, excluded from participation in, denied the benefits of, or otherwise be subjected to discrimination in its programs and/or activities. Any person believing they have been discriminated against may bring a complaint to the local civil rights coordinator: Assistant Superintendent, 27575 Harper, St Clair Shores MI 48081, 586-445-4000 x 2503
